text: :Turkey also has a mountain called Nemrut Nemrut (Turkish: Nemrut Dağı, Armenian: Սարակն, «Mountain spring», scientific transliteration: Sarakn, Kurdish Çiyayê Nemrud) is a dormant volcano in Eastern Turkey, close to Lake Van, at . The volcano is named after King Nimrod who is said to have ruled this area in about 2100 BC. == Other websites == * Photos from Nemrut * Nemrut - map Category:Volcanoes of Turkey Category:VEI-6 volcanoes Category:Mountains of Turkey
title: Nemrut (volcano)
